Forenote:\10\10 This app is for the ANT-BMS family of BMS. It will not work with any other BMS!\10\10 How to link the app to the BMS:\10\10 1. Select the Bluetooth icon on the top right of the screen (this will be a grey colour).\10 2. Select the appropriate device from the list (it usually starts with BMS-ANT).\10 3. Wait a few seconds and the Bluetooth icon will turn yellow.\10 4. Select the Bluetooth icon again and it should then connect and turn green.\10 5. If connection is not made, you might have selected the wrong Bluetooth device. In this case, go to the settings screen (bottom right icon) and select \'Remove connected Bluetooth device\'.\10 6. Go back to step 1 and try again.\10\10\10 Troubleshooting/FAQ:\10\10 Q: Why is the SOC displaying incorrectly?\10 A: On first install, you will have to go into the BMS settings screen (bottom left icon) where it will drag all the BMS data and store it for next use.\10\10 Q: Why are some digits missing on some screens?\10 A: You may have your system fonts set to extra large and the layout is optimised for standard screen layout. I have tried to scale the fonts to the screen size but there are limitations.\10\10 Q: How do I zero a positive or negative current showing with no load?\10 A: Go into the settings screen (bottom right icon) and select \'ZERO CURRENT\'.\10\10 Q: Why does the app keep crashing when I view the log files or maps?\10 A: The app was designed to log all the data and not view it (the viewer was only implemented because of pressure from users).\10 All phones have a memory limitation and the log files can be rather big and extremely memory hungry (especially when logging every second). This will cause a memory overflow and the app will crash.\10 If you want to view the logs, you can either export them to Excel or lower the log frequency to reduce the file size.\10 The log files are stored in:\10 Android > data > com.vortecks.vbms > files\10 The files are named as YYYYMMDD_HHMMSS.rdf and they are a comma delimited text file.\10\10 Q: I cannot find my BMS when trying to pair for the first time\10 A: Sometimes, the BMS isn\'t found on the first or second attempt. Go back to the main screen, select the Bluetooth icon and try again.\10\10 Q: What BMS is supported by this app?\10 A: The only BMS which are supported, are the ones which have an optional LCD and an integrated Bluetooth module. They are easily identified because the sellers are still using V1 of my app and they always include a screenshot.\10 VBMS WILL NOT WORK WITH ANY OTHER KIND OF BMS\10\10 Q: I cannot change any settings in the BMS. When I try to change anything, it reverts back to the original setting.\10 A: Google has forced me to only support later Android versions. If you are using anything below Android 8, it can be difficult to change anything.\10\10\10 Changelog:\10\10 V2.1.5 Fixes:\10\10 Auto-scaling of fonts - Some users were reporting that the fonts were too large when the system fonts were set to anything but standard.\10\10 Font colour on charge screen - Hard to see the lowest voltage readout on the charge screen in daylight so I changed the font colour from red to orange\10\10 The setting \'Maximum output current\' has been renamed to \'Current calibration factor\' - This is used to calibrate the input and output current (something which was lost in translation).\10\10 Unable to fix:\10\10 Battery voltage adjustment in the BMS settings - There seems to be a bug in the BMS firmware. The app is sending the command and a confirmation is received but sometimes, it actually does nothing.\10\10 Added features\10\10 Temperature (C/F) switch - Now able to select Celsius/Fahrenheit in the App Settings screen\10\10 Amp reverse switch - Some users said that the displayed Amps were the wrong way around and it should display negative when discharging and positive when charging. The BMS is reporting this incorrectly so I added a switch to manually override it (in the App Settings screen)\10\10 SOC (State Of Charge). This is a calculation of \'Battery total capacity\' and \'Battery reserve capacity\'\10\10 V2.1.6 Fix:\10\10 SOC was incorrectly displayed on some devices. It now drags the date from the BMS settings screen and stores it for future use
